intro: Labordia waiolani, commonly known as the Waiolani tree, is a species native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The tree is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Labordia waiolani plays an important role in the local ecosystem, providing habitat and food for native wildlife.
